tldr: Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to cache poisoning and host header manipulation due to insufficient validation of `X-Forwarded-Host`, `X-Forwarded-Proto`, and `X-Forwarded-Port` headers. Attackers could inject or manipulate these headers to bypass domain restrictions, influence routing, or poison caches. The fix introduces strict validation logicâ€”including sanitizing hostnames, validating protocols and ports against allowed domains, and rejecting invalid or path-injection style values.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a vulnerable version of the package.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `astro` library to the patch version.
